summary: WikiLeaks source (2010) - U.S. Army intelligence analyst who leaked Iraq War logs, Afghan War documents, and diplomatic cables exposing war crimes and government deceptions, sentenced 35 years, commuted by Obama (2017)
key_facts: U.S. Army intelligence analyst (2009-2010) with Top Secret clearance
WikiLeaks source: Leaked 750,000+ classified documents to WikiLeaks (2010)
Iraq War logs: Documented civilian casualties, torture, war crimes
Afghan War documents: Revealed Pakistan ISI support for Taliban, civilian deaths
Collateral Murder video: Apache helicopter killing of Reuters journalists in Baghdad (2007)
Arrested May 2010: Turned in by hacker Adrian Lamo after confession
Court-martial 2013: Convicted of 20 charges under Espionage Act, acquitted of 'aiding the enemy'
35-year sentence: Military prison at Fort Leavenworth
Commuted 2017: President Obama commuted sentence after 7 years
Released May 2017: Continued activism for transparency and whistleblower rights
Re-jailed 2019: Contempt for refusing to testify in secret grand jury against Assange
intelligence_connections: U.S. Army intelligence: Forward Operating Base Hammer, Iraq (2009-2010)
Classified databases: SIPRNet and JWICS access
WikiLeaks: Platform for publishing leaked documents
Julian Assange: WikiLeaks founder who published Manning's leaks
State Department: Diplomatic cables revealed internal communications
Pentagon: Iraq/Afghanistan war logs exposed military operations
CIA: Some diplomatic cables revealed intelligence operations
Reuters: Collateral Murder video showed killing of Reuters journalists
concealment_mechanisms: Classification system: Documents classified to hide war crimes, not protect security
Collateral damage concealment: Civilian death tolls underreported
Diplomatic cable secrecy: State Department communications hidden from public
War crimes coverups: Torture, civilian killings documented but concealed
Espionage Act prosecution: Whistleblower criminalized, no public interest defense allowed
Secret grand jury: Manning jailed for refusing to testify against Assange in sealed proceedings
Media complicity: Some outlets criticized leaks rather than exposed crimes
power_structure: Army intelligence analyst with classified access leaked to WikiLeaks, military justice system prosecuted under Espionage Act with no public interest defense, 35-year sentence intended to deter future whistleblowers, Obama commutation acknowledged injustice but didn't pardon, re-imprisonment shows continued punishment for refusing to cooperate against Assange
strategic_significance: Manning leaks exposed Iraq/Afghanistan war crimes and diplomatic duplicity - Collateral Murder video showed rules of engagement allowing civilian deaths, war logs revealed systematic casualty underreporting, diplomatic cables showed gap between public statements and private actions, prosecution established precedent for criminalizing national security whistleblowers without public interest defense
unanswered_questions: What other classified documents did Manning see but not leak?
How much torture and war crimes remain concealed in classified databases?
What was the full content of the secret grand jury investigation?
How many other military whistleblowers were deterred by Manning prosecution?
What intelligence operations were revealed in diplomatic cables?
Why was Manning jailed again for refusing to testify against Assange?
gap_addressed: Whistleblower Network - Iraq War logs, diplomatic cables, war crimes exposure, military whistleblower prosecution
